chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
8:54 AM Defendant Carizma Ahmya Hodges in court.  Attorney Kevin M Smith in court for Carizma Ahmya Hodges.  Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Calendar call on October 4, 2022 at 08:45 am.

2:10 PM Defendant Carizma Ahmya Hodges appeared by phone.  Attorney Colin T Nicholson in court for Carizma Ahmya Hodges.  Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Calendar call scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Status conference on September 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

9:21 AM Defendant Carizma Ahmya Hodges in court by video with attorney Ryan W O'Hara by video. Cheniqua White appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Zachary Stec of Beloit Police Department sworn testimony taken by video; Witness identified the defendant. State moves for bind over, defense objects. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set, bond to continue.
Preliminary hearing on May 3, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Activity: Adjourned initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

01:14 PM Defendant Carizma Ahmya Hodges in court by phone means and with attorney Ryan W O'Hara by video means.  Noah M Tylenda  and Intern Margaret Ginocchio appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video means.   Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived, by zoom.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 09:15 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on April 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Activity: Initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:31 PM Defendant Carizma Ahmya Hodges in court in custody at the Rock County Jail by video with attorney Ryan W O'Hara by video. Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Signature bond set of $1,000.00 with conditions: No contact with B&C Sports Bar and Grill. No intentional contact with Officer Stec or Officer Trulley.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 1PM.
